alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 10:01AM EST until January 01 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Coastal Ocean, Ocean, Eastern Monmouth, Western Monmouth, Southeastern Burlington and Middlesex. * WHEN...Until 11 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Arthur Kill at Perth Amboy MLLW Categories - Minor 7.2 ft, Moderate 8.2 ft, Major 9.2 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 01/06 AM 7.9 2.2 1.5 Minor 01/07 PM 6.7 1.0 1.7 None 02/07 AM 7.9 2.2 1.3 Minor 02/07 PM 6.5 0.8 1.4 None 03/08 AM 7.9 2.2 1.3 Minor 03/08 PM 6.8 1.1 1.6 None Watson Creek at Manasquan MLLW Categories - Minor 5.7 ft, Moderate 6.7 ft, Major 7.7 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 01/06 AM 6.3 1.9 1.0 Minor 01/06 PM 5.2 0.8 1.0 None 02/07 AM 6.3 1.9 0.8 Minor 02/07 PM 5.1 0.7 0.8 None 03/08 AM 6.3 1.9 0.8 Minor 03/08 PM 5.4 1.0 1.1 None Sandy Hook Bay at Sandy Hook MLLW Categories - Minor 6.7 ft, Moderate 7.7 ft, Major 8.7 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 01/06 AM 7.4 2.2 1.5 Minor 01/07 PM 6.2 1.0 1.6 None 02/07 AM 7.3 2.1 1.3 Minor 02/07 PM 6.1 0.9 1.4 None 03/08 AM 7.4 2.2 1.3 Minor 03/08 PM 6.3 1.1 1.5 None Barnegat Bay at Barnegat Light MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.0 ft, Moderate 2.0 ft, Major 3.0 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 01/06 AM 4.0 1.5 1.2 Minor 01/06 PM 3.1 0.6 1.2 None 02/07 AM 4.0 1.5 1.1 Minor 02/07 PM 3.1 0.6 1.1 None 03/08 AM 4.0 1.5 1.1 Minor 03/08 PM 3.3 0.8 1.3 None &&
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory means that minor tidal flooding is expected. Minor tidal flooding often results in some road closures. Usually, the most vulnerable roadways will flood. Do not leave your vehicle at a location that is prone to tidal flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flood waters. The water may be deeper than you think it is. You will be putting yourself in danger and your vehicle may be damaged, leading to costly repairs. Visit the Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service at water.weather.gov/ahps for additional water level and flood impact information for your local tide gauge.
